<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcfixup">MCFixup</a></>}>
Encode information on a single operation to perform on a byte sequence (e.g., an encoded instruction) which requires assemble- or run- time patching. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcfixup/#details">More...</a>

<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The range &#91;FirstLiteralRelocationKind, MaxTargetFixupKind) is used for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// relocations coming from .reloc directive. Fixup kind</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// FirstLiteralRelocationKind+V represents the relocation type with number V.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a84cef097f15848752272d38769011f58a1864d2003d3e30137067084e7f2e7898"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a84cef097f15848752272d38769011f58a1864d2003d3e30137067084e7f2e7898">FirstLiteralRelocationKind</a> = 256,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Set limit to accommodate the highest reloc type in use for all Targets,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// currently R&#95;AARCH64&#95;IRELATIVE at 1032, including room for expansion.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a84cef097f15848752272d38769011f58a59a8b044cb17aa6a16dd766e02308afe"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a84cef097f15848752272d38769011f58a59a8b044cb17aa6a16dd766e02308afe">MaxFixupKind</a> = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a84cef097f15848752272d38769011f58a1864d2003d3e30137067084e7f2e7898">FirstLiteralRelocationKind</a> + 1032 + 32,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Encode information on a single operation to perform on a byte</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="comment">/// sequence (e.g., an encoded instruction) which requires assemble- or run-</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">/// time patching.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Fixups are used any time the target instruction encoder needs to represent</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="comment">/// some value in an instruction which is not yet concrete. The encoder will</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="comment">/// encode the instruction assuming the value is 0, and emit a fixup which</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="comment">/// communicates to the assembler backend how it should rewrite the encoded</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="comment">/// value.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">/// During the process of relaxation, the assembler will apply fixups as</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">/// symbolic values become concrete. When relaxation is complete, any remaining</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">/// fixups become relocations in the object file (or errors, if the fixup cannot</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">/// be encoded on the target).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcfixup"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcfixup">MCFixup</a> &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The value to put into the fixup location. The exact interpretation of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// expression is target dependent, usually it will be one of the operands to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// an instruction or an assembler directive.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcexpr">MCExpr</a> &#42;Value = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The byte index of start of the relocation inside the MCFragment.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint32&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a05f5b9a11bdcc5feba62899f95dcf878a3134224cba2545bc57954d3b072aebb4">Offset</a> = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The target dependent kind of fixup item this is. The kind is used to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// determine how the operand value should be encoded into the instruction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a84cef097f15848752272d38769011f58">MCFixupKind</a> Kind = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a84cef097f15848752272d38769011f58a845a63cbed041d42d8c3452991d629c4">FK&#95;NONE</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
